revised_title: Exploring the Viscosity and Acoustic Impedance of Liquid Helium-3
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the viscosity and acoustic impedance of liquid helium-3. They found that the transition temperature of the impedance decreases and the magnitude of the change is reduced when the liquid is subjected to pressure. The results support Landau's theory of a Fermi liquid and the existence of zero sound in helium-3.
